data.meta_site_name: Singersroom.com - R&B Music, R&B Videos, R&B News
data.text:
Kisses have been a popular subject in music for generations, inspiring countless songs that celebrate the joy, passion, and power of this simple act. From tender ballads to upbeat pop anthems, songs about kisses have captured the hearts of listeners and become timeless classics. In this article, we will be taking a look at the top 20 songs with “kiss” in the title, exploring the rich history and diversity of this musical genre. From rock and roll to country, hip-hop to pop, each of these songs brings its own unique perspective and style to the subject of kissing. Whether you’re a fan of classic oldies, modern chart-toppers, or something in between, this list has something for everyone. So sit back, relax, and get ready to explore the very best in kiss-themed music.

1. “One Kiss” by Bryan Ferry

“One Kiss” is a song by British singer Bryan Ferry, released in 1985 as part of his album “Boys and Girls”. The song features a sleek, sophisticated melody, complete with a smooth, jazzy saxophone solo, and showcases Ferry’s distinctive, crooning voice. The lyrics describe a longing for a single, perfect kiss, and express the power that this simple act can have in creating a lasting memory. The song’s stylish and romantic tone, combined with its catchy melody, have made it one of Ferry’s most popular tracks, and a standout example of his smooth and sophisticated style. Despite its vintage release date, “One Kiss” remains a timeless classic, and continues to be beloved by fans of sophisticated pop music to this day.

2. “Hold Me, Thrill Me, Kiss Me, Kill Me” by U2

“Hold Me, Thrill Me, Kiss Me, Kill Me” is an upbeat and energetic rock song by Irish band U2, released as a single in 1995. The song is known for its catchy guitar riff and anthemic chorus, making it a standout track from the band’s album “Original Soundtracks 1”. The lyrics deal with the theme of desire and temptation, as the singer reflects on the dangerous allure of love and the consequences of giving into it. The song features a blend of rock, pop, and electronic elements, creating a sound that is both upbeat and introspective. “Hold Me, Thrill Me, Kiss Me, Kill Me” has become a fan favorite, and remains a staple of U2’s live shows, where it always elicits energetic responses from audiences. Whether you’re a fan of classic rock or just appreciate great music, “Hold Me, Thrill Me, Kiss Me, Kill Me” is a must-listen track.

3. “In France They Kiss on Main Street” by Joni Mitchell

“In France They Kiss on Main Street” is a folksy and whimsical song by Canadian singer-songwriter Joni Mitchell. The song was released in 1975 as part of the album “The Hissing of Summer Lawns.” It is a lighthearted and nostalgic track that reflects on a trip to France and the cultural differences between the singer’s home country and Europe. The lyrics of “In France They Kiss on Main Street” are characterized by their sense of humor and wistfulness, and are accompanied by delicate acoustic guitar and a relaxed, upbeat rhythm. The song’s charming melody and breezy atmosphere make it a standout track on “The Hissing of Summer Lawns” and a perfect representation of Joni Mitchell’s distinctive and eclectic musical style. “In France They Kiss on Main Street” continues to be a beloved classic among fans of Joni Mitchell and is a testament to her talents as a songwriter and storyteller.

4. “Kiss Me In the Rain” by Barbra Streisand

“Kiss Me in the Rain” is a song by legendary singer and actress Barbra Streisand, released in 1977 as part of her album “Songbird”. The song features a lush and romantic melody, complete with a sweeping orchestral arrangement, and showcases Streisand’s powerful and emotional voice. The lyrics describe a scene of two lovers kissing in the rain, and express the depth of feeling that this intimate moment can evoke. The song’s dramatic and passionate tone, combined with its soaring chorus, make it a standout track, and a perfect representation of Streisand’s exceptional vocal range and interpretive skills. Over the years, “Kiss Me in the Rain” has become one of Streisand’s most beloved and enduring tracks, and is considered a classic of the adult contemporary genre.

5. “I’ll Kiss You” by Cyndi Lauper

“I’ll Kiss You” is a upbeat and playful pop song by American singer and songwriter Cyndi Lauper, released on her 1988 album “A Night to Remember”. The song is a lighthearted and catchy track, featuring Lauper’s signature powerful and distinctive vocals. The lyrics are a love song, as the singer promises to kiss her lover and make everything okay. The song is upbeat and energetic, with a memorable chorus that sticks in your head long after the music has stopped playing. “I’ll Kiss You” is a standout track in Cyndi Lauper’s discography, showcasing her ability to craft fun and uplifting pop songs that are both infectious and memorable. The song has become a fan favorite, and continues to receive widespread acclaim from audiences and critics alike. Whether you’re a fan of upbeat pop or just appreciate great music, “I’ll Kiss You” is a must-listen track.

6. “Kiss Me Quick” by Elvis Presley

“Kiss Me Quick” is a rock ‘n’ roll classic by the King of Rock and Roll, Elvis Presley. The song was released in 1963 and became a hit for Presley, reaching the top 40 on the Billboard Hot 100. “Kiss Me Quick” is a upbeat, energetic track characterized by its infectious rhythm, driving beat, and powerful vocals by Elvis. The lyrics are romantic and playful, with Elvis crooning about the joys of falling in love and the thrill of a kiss. The song’s catchy melody and upbeat energy make it a standout track on Elvis’ extensive discography and a perfect representation of the King’s early rock ‘n’ roll sound. “Kiss Me Quick” continues to be a beloved classic among fans of Elvis Presley and remains a testament to his enduring legacy as one of the most influential and iconic musicians of all time.

7. “Kiss Them For Me” by Siouxsie And The Banshees

“Kiss Them for Me” is a song by the British post-punk band Siouxsie and the Banshees, released in 1991 as the lead single from their album “Superstition”. The song features a haunting and ethereal melody, driven by a driving bassline and a tribal rhythm, and showcases Siouxsie Sioux’s distinctive and haunting voice. The lyrics are cryptic and open to interpretation, with some listeners interpreting the song as a message from the dead to their loved ones, or a commentary on the seductive power of fame. Despite the ambiguity of the lyrics, the song’s powerful and evocative sound has made it a fan favorite, and a standout example of Siouxsie and the Banshees’ unique style and musical vision. Over the years, “Kiss Them for Me” has become one of the band’s most popular and enduring tracks, and is considered a classic of the alternative music genre.

8. “The Perfect Kiss” by Bette Midler

“The Perfect Kiss” is a soulful and emotional ballad by American singer and actress Bette Midler, released on her 2014 album “It’s the Girls”. The song is a beautiful and tender track, featuring Midler’s signature rich and powerful voice. The lyrics are a love song, as the singer reflects on the idea of finding the perfect kiss with someone special. The song is slow and mellow, with a lush and melodic arrangement that showcases Midler’s vocal range and emotional depth. “The Perfect Kiss” is a standout track in Bette Midler’s extensive discography, showcasing her ability to craft moving and meaningful ballads that resonate with audiences. The song is a fan favorite, and continues to receive widespread acclaim from audiences and critics alike. Whether you’re a fan of soulful ballads or just appreciate great music, “The Perfect Kiss” is a must-listen track.

9. “Kiss the Future” by The Human League

“Kiss the Future” is a synth-pop classic by the British band The Human League. The song was released in 1991 as part of the album “Romantic?” and became a hit for the band, reaching the top 40 in several countries. “Kiss the Future” is a upbeat and energetic track characterized by its catchy synth hooks, driving rhythm, and soaring vocals. The lyrics are optimistic and futuristic, with the band singing about the power of hope and the promise of a better future. The song’s upbeat and futuristic sound make it a standout track on “Romantic?” and a perfect representation of The Human League’s iconic synth-pop style. “Kiss the Future” continues to be a beloved classic among fans of The Human League and remains a testament to the band’s innovative and enduring contributions to the synth-pop genre.

10. “This Kiss” by Faith Hill

“This Kiss” is a song by American country singer Faith Hill, released in 1998 as the lead single from her album “Faith”. The song features a lively and upbeat melody, complete with a catchy chorus and a bouncy rhythm, and showcases Hill’s powerful and emotive voice. The lyrics describe the heady and intoxicating feeling of a new love, and express the hope and excitement of this special moment. The song’s cheerful and romantic tone, combined with its infectious melody, have made it a fan favorite and a staple of country radio. Over the years, “This Kiss” has become one of Hill’s biggest hits, and is considered a classic of the country-pop genre. Whether you’re a fan of country music or just looking for a feel-good love song, “This Kiss” is sure to bring a smile to your face and a bounce to your step.

11. “Kiss From A Rose” by Seal

“Kiss From a Rose” is a soulful and powerful ballad by British singer-songwriter Seal. The song was released in 1994 as part of the album “Seal” and became a massive commercial success, reaching number one on the charts in several countries and winning three Grammy Awards. “Kiss From a Rose” is a tender and romantic ballad characterized by its haunting melody, soaring vocals, and sweeping orchestral arrangement. The lyrics of the song express a deep and passionate love, with Seal singing about the power of a kiss to heal and bring hope. The song’s emotional delivery and powerful musical arrangement make it a standout track on “Seal” and a perfect representation of Seal’s soulful and powerful musical style. “Kiss From a Rose” continues to be a beloved classic among fans of Seal and is a testament to his enduring legacy as one of the greatest soul and R&B artists of all time.

12. “First Kiss” by Kid Rock

“First Kiss” is a rowdy and upbeat country-rock song by American singer and rapper Kid Rock, released on his 2015 album of the same name. The song is a high-energy and catchy track, featuring Kid Rock’s signature raspy and raunchy vocals. The lyrics are a nostalgic reflection on the experience of a first kiss, as the singer reminisces about the thrill and excitement of a new romance. The song is driven by a catchy guitar riff, and features a rowdy and upbeat arrangement that perfectly captures Kid Rock’s rowdy and rebellious spirit. “First Kiss” is a standout track in Kid Rock’s eclectic discography, showcasing his ability to craft fun and upbeat country-rock songs that are both catchy and memorable. The song is a fan favorite, and continues to receive widespread acclaim from audiences and critics alike. Whether you’re a fan of country-rock or just appreciate great music, “First Kiss” is a must-listen track.

13. “Kiss” by Prince

“Kiss” is a song by the iconic musician Prince, released in 1986 as the lead single from his album “Parade”. The song features a funky and upbeat melody, complete with a driving bassline and a catchy chorus, and showcases Prince’s distinctive and soulful voice. The lyrics describe the seductive power of a kiss, and express the sensual energy and excitement of this intimate moment. The song’s upbeat and playful tone, combined with its infectious melody, have made it a fan favorite and a staple of dance radio. Over the years, “Kiss” has become one of Prince’s biggest hits, and is considered a classic of the funk and soul genres. Whether you’re a fan of dance music or just looking for a funky and upbeat party song, “Kiss” is sure to get your feet moving and your body grooving.

14. “Kiss On My List” by Hall & Oates

“Kiss on My List” is a upbeat and catchy pop classic by American duo Hall & Oates. The song was released in 1981 as part of the album “Voices” and became a hit for the duo, reaching the top of the charts in several countries. “Kiss on My List” is a upbeat and energetic track characterized by its catchy melody, driving rhythm, and smooth harmonies. The lyrics of the song are lighthearted and playful, with Hall & Oates singing about the joys of being in love and the thrill of a kiss. The song’s upbeat and cheerful sound make it a standout track on “Voices” and a perfect representation of Hall & Oates’ signature pop sound. “Kiss on My List” continues to be a beloved classic among fans of Hall & Oates and remains a testament to the duo’s enduring popularity and influence on the pop music scene.

15. “Kiss Me” by Sixpence None The Richer

“Kiss Me” is a song by American alternative rock band Sixpence None the Richer, released in 1997 as the lead single from their self-titled album. The song features a gentle and delicate melody, complete with a lilting acoustic guitar and a tender vocal performance from singer Leigh Nash, and showcases the band’s distinctive and heartfelt style. The lyrics describe the longing and desire of a young couple, and express the hope and tenderness of a new love. The song’s simple and understated tone, combined with its ethereal and atmospheric sound, have made it a fan favorite and a standout example of the alternative pop genre. Over the years, “Kiss Me” has become one of Sixpence None the Richer’s biggest hits, and is considered a classic of the 1990s music scene. Whether you’re a fan of alternative rock or just looking for a heartfelt and emotional love song, “Kiss Me” is sure to capture your heart and bring a tear to your eye.

16. “Kiss Me Deadly” by Lita Ford

“Kiss Me Deadly” is a hard-hitting rock classic by American singer-songwriter and guitarist Lita Ford. The song was released in 1988 as part of the album “Lita” and became a hit for Ford, reaching the top 40 on the charts. “Kiss Me Deadly” is a powerful and energetic track characterized by its driving rhythm, crunchy guitar riffs, and raw vocal delivery. The lyrics of the song are bold and confident, with Ford singing about the danger and excitement of love. The song’s explosive energy and tough rock sound make it a standout track on “Lita” and a perfect representation of Ford’s hard-rocking musical style. “Kiss Me Deadly” continues to be a beloved classic among fans of Lita Ford and remains a testament to her enduring influence on the heavy metal and hard rock genres.

17. “Can We Kiss Forever?” by Kina feat. Adriana Proenza

“Can We Kiss Forever?” is a soft and romantic pop ballad by American singer Kina, featuring Mexican singer Adriana Proenza. The song was released in 2019 and quickly became a hit, reaching millions of streams on popular music platforms. The song is a tender and emotional track, featuring Kina’s smooth and soulful vocals and Adriana Proenza’s hauntingly beautiful voice. The lyrics are a love song, as the singers reflect on the idea of kissing forever, wishing for their love to never fade away. The song is mellow and slow, with a lush and melodic arrangement that perfectly showcases the beauty of the lyrics and the singers’ voices. “Can We Kiss Forever?” is a standout track in both Kina and Adriana Proenza’s discographies, showcasing their ability to craft touching and romantic ballads that resonate with audiences. The song continues to be a fan favorite, and has received widespread acclaim from audiences and critics alike. Whether you’re a fan of romantic ballads or just appreciate great music, “Can We Kiss Forever?” is a must-listen track.

18. “Kiss and Say Goodbye” by The Manhattans

“Kiss and Say Goodbye” is a song by American R&B group The Manhattans, released in 1976 as a single from their album “Forever by Your Side”. The song features a smooth and soulful melody, complete with lush harmonies and a heartfelt vocal performance from lead singer Gerald Alston, and showcases the band’s signature blend of R&B and soul. The lyrics describe the pain and heartache of a couple saying goodbye, and express the sadness and regret of a love that has come to an end. The song’s poignant and emotional tone, combined with its powerful and soulful sound, have made it a fan favorite and a staple of R&B radio. Over the years, “Kiss and Say Goodbye” has become one of The Manhattans’ biggest hits, and is considered a classic of the 1970s soul era. Whether you’re a fan of R&B or just looking for a heartfelt and moving ballad, “Kiss and Say Goodbye” is sure to touch your heart and leave a lasting impression.

19. “This Kiss” by Carly Rae Jepsen

“This Kiss” is a upbeat and catchy pop hit by Canadian singer-songwriter Carly Rae Jepsen. The song was released in 2012 as part of the album “Kiss” and became a huge commercial success, reaching the top 10 on the charts in several countries. “This Kiss” is a upbeat and energetic track characterized by its bouncy melody, upbeat rhythm, and infectious chorus. The lyrics of the song are playful and flirty, with Jepsen singing about the thrill of a first kiss and the rush of new love. The song’s cheerful and upbeat sound make it a standout track on “Kiss” and a perfect representation of Jepsen’s catchy and upbeat pop style. “This Kiss” continues to be a beloved hit among fans of Carly Rae Jepsen and remains a testament to her enduring popularity and influence on the pop music scene.

20. “Shut Up and Kiss Me” by Mary Chapin Carpenter

“Shut Up and Kiss Me” is a lively and upbeat country-pop song by American singer-songwriter Mary Chapin Carpenter, released on her 1994 album “Stones in the Road”. The song is a fast-paced and catchy track, featuring Carpenter’s signature rich and soulful voice. The lyrics are a playful expression of desire, as the singer urges her love interest to simply “shut up and kiss me”. The song is driven by a catchy guitar riff, and features a lively and upbeat arrangement that perfectly captures the energy and excitement of a new romance. “Shut Up and Kiss Me” is a standout track in Mary Chapin Carpenter’s extensive discography, showcasing her ability to craft fun and upbeat country-pop songs that are both catchy and memorable. The song is a fan favorite, and continues to receive widespread acclaim from audiences and critics alike. Whether you’re a fan of country-pop or just appreciate great music, “Shut Up and Kiss Me” is a must-listen track.
